{"step_by_step_thinking": "Heparin is an anticoagulant, or blood thinner, that prevents the formation of blood clots. In case of an overdose or if there is a need to reverse its effects, an antidote is used. Penicillinase is an enzyme that breaks down penicillin and is not related to heparin. Pyrosulphate and potassium sulphate are also not related to heparin. Protamine sulphate, on the other hand, is a drug that is known to neutralize the effects of heparin.", "answer_choice": "B. Protamine sulphate"}
